flawed_nl_solution:
Ten years from now, the elder child will be 20+10 = <<10+20=30>>30 years old.
If the elder child is 20 years old now, the second born is 20-5 = <<20-5=13>>13 years old, 5 years younger than the firstborn.
The second-born will be 13+10 = 23 years old ten years from now.
The total age of the first and second-born 10 years from now will be 23+30 = <<23+30=53>>53
The third-born who is five years younger than the second born is 13-5 = <<13-5=8>>8 years old.
The third sibling's age ten years from now will be 8+10 = <<8+10=18>>18 years old.
The total age of the three siblings ten years from now will be 53+18 = <<53+18=71>>71 years.
#### 71

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 15, not 13. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
